definition: mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve

sentences.english: This thesis reviews the background of tax barriers and customs of the Taiping Heavenly Kingdom.
sentences.chinese: 本文考察了太平天国税关与海关的设立背景。

sentences.english: To be concise, this means that he stands up from his tax post and follows Jesus.
sentences.chinese: 简而言之，这意味著离开他的税关，去跟随耶稣。

sentences.english: As he walked along, he saw a tax collector sitting in his office. This was Levi, the son of Alpheus .
sentences.chinese: 路上，他瞧见阿耳斐的儿子肋未正坐在税关亭里。

definition: a form of transit taxation in China introduced to finance armies to suppress the Taiping Rebellion
(old) to transport by water/to ship grain as tax
having trading relations (of nations or regions)
government repository/state provincial warehouse (esp. during Qing dynasty)
treaty port, forced on Qing China by the 19th century Great Powers
forced labor of feudal tenant (corvée)/bailiff of feudal yamen
